summary: THE FRONT END OF THE MOTORCYCLE MADE A LOUD NOISE.   UPON INSPECTION OF THE MOTORCYCLE BY THE DEALERSHIP, THEY INDICATED THE FRONT WHEEL WAS WOBBLING AND THE SPACER BAR WAS MOBILE ALSO.   THE SPACER BAR WAS TIGHTENED, HOWEVER 2 WEEKS LATER,  THE FRONT END SEIZED UP AND THE BIKE FLIPPED OVER.  *JB  THE FRONT TIRE FAILED AND CAUSED THE BIKE TO FALL.  THE CONSUMER HAS MADE REPEATED COMPLAINTS ABOUT THE FONT TIRE SINCE PURCHASE.  SCC
